subject: Web3
title: The Right-Click Save Debate
description: Learn The Right-Click Save Debate in one minute.

hook.text: 'Why would I buy an NFT when I can right-click and save the image?' It's the most common criticism.

buildup.text: Critics argue that anyone can copy a digital file, so paying thousands for one makes no sense.

discovery.text: NFT supporters compare it to art prints. You can photograph the Mona Lisa, but the original still has value.

twist.text: The value isn't in the pixels. It's in the provenance ‚Äî the blockchain record of who created and owned it.

climax.text: Whether that provenance is worth millions is the real question. The market has given mixed answers.

punchline.text: You can copy the image. You can't copy the proof of ownership.

quiz.question: What gives an NFT value beyond the image itself?
options: Blockchain-verified provenance and proof of ownership
